s.text: Currently, eight million disabled people of working age receive more than $50 billion a year from Social Security and Supplemental Security Income, says the paper, and fewer than 1 percent of them work.

The New York Times goes with word that President Clinton will propose expanding Medicaid and Medicare to allow those with disabilities to continue receiving benefits even if they work.
